page.title: 06ANIMAL LIFE
page.content: The area is principally farmland, moor land and woodland all rich in animal life. All the more common wild animals are seen. Rabbits are now multiplying and can be seen during the day in fields & in natural cover. Hares are seen more often in the Spring when courting. Hedgehogs are unfortunately often the victims of car drivers, but whilst being slaughtered in large numbers continue to survive. Moles are evidenced by their "hills". They are trapped by farmers because of the way they disrupt land. Stoats and weasels feed on mice & voles. Foxes are a threat to smaller animals and domestic fowl. These are shut away at night for their protection. Grey squirrels have driven out their red relatives. Roe deer can be seen on the edges of forests.
